Kevin Qian
MEng Candidate
MIT Department of EECS
Resume
Google Scholar
Github

I am pursuing a Masters of Engineering at MIT, advised by Jonathan Ragan-Kelley. My research interests include domain specific languages, compilers, and hardware architectures for high performance computing. Currently, I work on EXO, a user-schedulable, domain specific language embedded in Python for writing high-performance computing kernels. You can read the original paper here.

Previously, I obtained my bachelors in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from MIT in 2023. I’ve also interned at Meta, D.E. Shaw & Co., Jane Street, and the University of Maryland’s Joint Quantum Institute.

I’m also a member of MIT Lion Dance, MIT Gymnastics, and MIT Asian Dance Team.


Publications

Heisenberg-scaling measurement protocol for analytic functions with quantum sensor networks
Kevin Qian, Zachary Eldredge, Wenchao Ge, Guido Pagano, Christopher Monroe, James V. Porto, and Alexey V. Gorshkov
